document.forum_title: Breaking News Updates | Latest News Headlines | Photos - News Videos
document.discussion_title: Drake and Future set new tour
document.topic_text: 10:10 Drake and Future set new tour See more of Entertainment’s top stories on Facebook >>Frequent Drake collaborator and "What A Time to Be Alive" partner Future will be the main support, with new OVO Sound signings DVSN and Roy Woods. Tickets for the shows go on... Share on Facebook Tweet The world is waking up to "Lemonade," but Drake has a major announcement of his own. The singer has announced a run of "Summer Sixteen" tour dates tied to the impending release of "Views From the 6," his new album out Friday. The tour kicks off in July and lands in L.A. at Staples Center on Sept. 7 and 9. See more of Entertainment’s top stories on Facebook >> Frequent Drake collaborator and "What A Time to Be Alive" partner Future will be the main support, with new OVO Sound signings DVSN and Roy Woods. Tickets for the shows go on sale Friday. See the most-read stories in Entertainment this hour >>Read the story Drake has also set the date for the next annual OVO Fest, on July 29 at the Molson Amphitheatre in Toronto. Guests include Snoop Dogg and Wiz Khalifa. Drake previously tipped the cover art for the LP, where he sits plaintively atop Toronto's CN Tower. The view indeed looks nice from up there. Follow @AugustBrown for breaking music news.
